qas.question: How did the original Xbox fare in Japan in general?
How many original Xboxes were sold in Japan between 2002 and 2005?
Between 2005 and 2011, how many 360 consoles were sold in Japan?
What two console manufacturers dominate the Japanese market?
Lackluster sales caused Japanese retailers to take what action with the 360?

answers.text: scaling down and in some cases discontinuing sales

qas.question: Where did the Xbox sell exceptionally well?
How many of the original Xbox sell between 2005 and 2011?
How many units did Sony sell in 202 through 2005?
What console, released in 2005, did Sony create?
When did Edge report Sony sales were falling?

context: While the original Xbox <a0_0>sold poorly<a0_0/> in <b5_0>Japan<b5_0/>, selling just <a1_0><b7_0>2 million<b7_0/> units<a1_0/> while it was on the market (between 2002 and 2005),[citation needed] the <b8_0>Xbox 360<b8_0/> sold even more poorly, selling only <a2_0><b6_0>1.5 million<b6_0/> units<a2_0/> from 2005 to 2011. Edge magazine reported in <b9_0>August 2011<b9_0/> that initially lackluster and subsequently falling sales in Japan, where Microsoft had been unable to make serious inroads into the dominance of domestic rivals <a3_0>Sony and Nintendo<a3_0/>, had led to retailers <a4_0>scaling down and in some cases discontinuing sales<a4_0/> of the Xbox 360 completely.
